content.description: Short route with same start as Easy Huecos, then veer up and right past big huecos to the top.
content.protection: Probably med to big cams plus tricams, gear anchor.
content.location: Short face with big huecos near the right side of wall.

content.description: Up the face past many huecos.  Double length slings helpful to sling through huecos.  Topside anchor could include very long webbing around a rock feature to climber's left and slightly higher than the topout (just before the walkoff traverse gap) and partially on the backside, plus possible cams nearby.  Located on the taller left side of the main wall with the many attractive holes.
content.protection: Big Bro #5, tricam #3.5, single cams from medium up to an optional BD #4, plus very long webbing for topside anchor.

content.description: Start up face with cobble-pebbles until placements could be made via the huecos.  Careful with the cobbles.  They could easily leverage out, tho some would leave behind excavated huecos with positive lip. Couple of big huecos at the top actually burrow through to the backside, which is a hollowed out big cave.  Could anchor with long webbing(s) through those two huecos and over the top.
content.protection: Single cams 0.5" and up, plus tricams.  Long webbing for topside anchor.

content.description: Start up an unprotected bulge to connect to easier huecos that lead to the top. Double length slings can be used to thread through connecting huecos for pro, among others. Once past the starting buldge, the climbing eases to 5.5 or so. Couple of big huecos at the top actually burrow through to the backside, which is a hollowed out big cave.  Could anchor with long webbing(s) through those two huecos and over the top.
content.protection: Single med to big cams plus tricams.  Long webbings for topside anchor.

content.description: Short route up big huecos near the right side of the wall.  Ran this trail one early morning before the crowds.  Freesolo'd that time to check out anchor requirements for the various summit topouts at the taller parts of the wall, so don't remember that well about the possible gear on this.
content.protection: Probably med to big cams plus tricams, gear anchor.
content.location: Shorter portion of the wall first encountered along the way up the base trail.
